prd.description: Stage-based Node.js Express journey with atomic stories for core setup, CRUD logic with security validation, and a simple UI plus analytics.

stages.name: Stage 1: Build Core
stages.mission: Establish the foundational server and storage utilities needed for later features.

stories.title: Initialize Express server
stories.description: Set up a basic Node.js Express app with a health check route and configurable port.

stories.title: Create JSON file storage utility
stories.description: Implement a reusable module to read/write notes to a JSON file with safe initialization.

stages.name: Stage 2: Logic
stages.mission: Deliver complete Note CRUD and a robust security validator for sensitive content detection.

stories.title: Define Note model shape
stories.description: Specify required fields for a Note (id, title, content, timestamps) and validation rules.

stories.title: Implement Create Note endpoint
stories.description: Add POST /notes with input validation and persistence via JSON storage.

stories.title: Implement Read Notes endpoints
stories.description: Add GET /notes and GET /notes/:id with proper error handling.

stories.title: Implement Update Note endpoint
stories.description: Add PUT /notes/:id to update title/content with validation and persistence.

stories.title: Implement Delete Note endpoint
stories.description: Add DELETE /notes/:id to remove notes and return appropriate status.

stories.title: Research credit card detection patterns
stories.description: Gather rules for identifying common credit card formats (lengths, prefixes, Luhn check).

stories.title: Build Luhn checksum helper
stories.description: Create a helper function that validates numeric strings using the Luhn algorithm.

stories.title: Create candidate extractor for note content
stories.description: Parse note text to extract potential card number sequences with separators and spacing.

stories.title: Implement Security Validator function
stories.description: Combine extraction, pattern checks, and Luhn validation to flag credit card numbers.

stories.title: Integrate Security Validator into CRUD
stories.description: Run validation on create/update and return a structured warning response when flagged.

stages.name: Stage 3: UI & Extra
stages.mission: Provide a minimal dashboard to view notes and add optional analytics.

stories.title: Create HTML dashboard
stories.description: Serve a simple HTML page that lists notes and allows refresh of note data.

stories.title: Wire dashboard to notes API
stories.description: Fetch notes from the API and render them in the dashboard using basic client-side JS.

stories.title: Advanced Analytics: Word frequency
stories.description: Compute word frequency across all notes and expose it via an endpoint for optional UI use.

prd.description: Create a premium Crypto Portfolio Tracker with a high-end dark glassmorphism UI, real-time prices from a public API, mock holdings management, and Chart.js portfolio distribution. Emphasize neon accents, smooth transitions, and mobile responsiveness.

stories.title: Define data models

stories.title: Set up price service

stories.title: Wire app state

stories.title: Create base layout

stories.title: Add holding form

stories.title: Holdings list

stories.title: Edit and remove holdings

prd.description: Stage-based delivery plan to build a polished, deterministic, web-based Tower Defense game with strong architecture, performance, UX, visual/audio polish, testing, and progression.

stages.name: Stage 1: Build Core
stages.mission: Establish a production-grade foundation that runs locally, compiles strictly, and supports deterministic fixed-timestep simulation.

stories.title: Initialize Vite + TypeScript ESM project
stories.description: Create the base repo with npm scripts, TypeScript config, and browser entrypoint.

stories.title: Enable strict TypeScript and lint/format pipeline
stories.description: Configure strict tsconfig, ESLint, and Prettier with zero-warning baseline.

stories.title: Create deterministic RNG service
stories.description: Implement seed-based random utility and inject it into simulation systems.

stories.title: Implement fixed timestep loop (60 Hz) with interpolation
stories.description: Separate simulation tick from render frame and add interpolation alpha for smooth visuals.

stories.title: Define modular system architecture
stories.description: Create clean boundaries for Simulation, Rendering, Input, UI, Audio, and Data modules.

stories.title: Set up data-driven config layer
stories.description: Add typed config files for towers, enemies, waves, economy, and difficulty scaling.

stories.title: Add core test harness with Vitest
stories.description: Configure unit test runner and create first deterministic simulation tests.

stages.name: Stage 2: Playable Loop
stages.mission: Deliver a complete playable tower defense loop with pathing, combat, waves, economy, and lose/win conditions.

stories.title: Implement map grid and enemy pathing
stories.description: Create grid/spline path definitions and enemy movement along authored routes.

stories.title: Build tower placement and validation
stories.description: Add tile hover, valid/invalid placement feedback, and placement confirmation flow.

stories.title: Implement Basic DPS tower
stories.description: Create targeting, projectile/hitscan logic, cooldown timing, and damage application.

stories.title: Implement Splash tower
stories.description: Add area damage calculations and impact radius visualization.

stories.title: Implement Slow/Freeze tower
stories.description: Apply timed movement debuffs with stacking/refresh rules.

stories.title: Implement Sniper tower
stories.description: Add long-range high-damage behavior with slower fire cadence.

stories.title: Create enemy archetypes
stories.description: Implement fast, tank, shielded, and boss enemies with unique stats/behaviors.

stories.title: Implement boss phase logic
stories.description: Create boss state transitions by HP thresholds and phase-specific modifiers.

stories.title: Create wave spawning system
stories.description: Implement scalable wave definitions, timings, and completion checks.

stories.title: Add elite modifiers
stories.description: Apply optional per-wave enemy buffs (speed, armor, regeneration, etc.).

stories.title: Implement currency and reward flow
stories.description: Grant currency on kills/wave clear and spend on tower placement/upgrades.

stories.title: Implement tower upgrade system
stories.description: Support damage, range, fire rate, and special ability upgrade tracks.

stories.title: Add game state transitions
stories.description: Handle start, pause, wave start/end, game over, and victory states.

stages.name: Stage 3: Visual & Feel Polish
stages.mission: Elevate presentation to premium indie/AA quality with polished rendering, feedback, and camera controls.

stories.title: Build top-down camera controller
stories.description: Implement smooth pan/zoom and optional orbit constraints for tactical readability.

stories.title: Add responsive input mapping
stories.description: Support mouse and keyboard controls with clear interaction states.

stories.title: Apply PBR-style materials
stories.description: Use MeshStandardMaterial and tuned material presets for towers, terrain, and enemies.

stories.title: Implement environment lighting and soft shadows
stories.description: Configure procedural lighting setup and shadow quality/performance settings.

stories.title: Add post-processing chain
stories.description: Integrate Bloom, SSAO, Vignette, and subtle chromatic aberration.

stories.title: Implement particle FX system
stories.description: Create pooled particles for muzzle flashes, impacts, explosions, and kill bursts.

stories.title: Implement hit-stop and screen shake
stories.description: Add impact-driven temporal slowdown and camera shake with intensity scaling.

stories.title: Add easing-based UI/world animations
stories.description: Animate tower selection, placement confirmation, and wave transitions with smooth easing.

stories.title: Implement hover and selection feedback
stories.description: Show outlines/range rings/reticles and contextual highlights for interactions.

stages.name: Stage 4: UX, Menus, and Audio
stages.mission: Deliver complete in-game UX, menu flows, and clear audio feedback across all key events.

stories.title: Create modern overlay HUD
stories.description: Build responsive HTML/CSS UI for health, currency, wave info, and action buttons.

stories.title: Implement main menu
stories.description: Add start flow, settings entrypoints, and polished transitions.

stories.title: Implement pause menu
stories.description: Support pause/resume/restart with simulation freeze and UI state sync.

stories.title: Implement game over and victory screens
stories.description: Create end-state summaries, score display, and replay actions.

stories.title: Add tower tooltips and iconography
stories.description: Display tower stats, upgrade deltas, and concise descriptions with visual clarity.

stories.title: Implement WebAudio mixer
stories.description: Create master/music/sfx buses and runtime volume controls.

stories.title: Generate procedural SFX
stories.description: Synthesize key event sounds when asset files are unavailable.

stories.title: Add spatialized gameplay audio
stories.description: Apply positional audio cues for impacts, tower firing, and major enemy events.

stories.title: Wire event audio feedback
stories.description: Play distinct sounds for placement, hits, kills, and wave start/end.

stages.name: Stage 5: Performance, Persistence, and Quality Gates
stages.mission: Harden runtime performance, save progression, and ship with tests plus smoke validation.

stories.title: Introduce object pooling
stories.description: Pool projectiles, particles, and transient effects to reduce GC spikes.

stories.title: Use instanced meshes for repeated units
stories.description: Batch render repeated enemies/props with instance transforms and per-instance data.

stories.title: Add frustum culling strategy
stories.description: Avoid rendering off-screen objects and tune culling behavior for gameplay camera.

stories.title: Reduce per-frame allocations
stories.description: Refactor hot paths to reuse vectors/arrays and avoid transient object churn.

stories.title: Implement LocalStorage save system
stories.description: Persist currency, upgrades, and high scores with schema versioning.

stories.title: Add balance and scaling controls
stories.description: Expose tunable formulas and default values for difficulty ramp and economy pacing.

stories.title: Expand unit tests for core systems
stories.description: Add focused tests for RNG determinism, combat math, wave scheduler, and upgrades.

stories.title: Add Playwright smoke test
stories.description: Verify app boot, menu navigation, and entering a playable game state.

stories.title: Prepare final developer documentation
stories.description: Document project tree, setup/run steps, architecture rationale, and file-by-file source expectations.

stages.name: Stage 6: Optional Premium Extras
stages.mission: Add high-value optional features that increase delight without destabilizing the core game.

stories.title: Implement mini map
stories.description: Render tactical mini map showing paths, tower positions, and enemy progress.

stories.title: Add damage numbers
stories.description: Show floating combat text with lightweight pooled rendering.

stories.title: Implement combo/streak system
stories.description: Track kill chains and grant score/currency bonuses with decay timing.

stories.title: Add subtle environment animation
stories.description: Introduce wind sway/moving props to enhance scene liveliness.

stories.title: Implement day/night tint shift
stories.description: Apply gradual lighting/post FX tint changes across match progression.

prd.description: A web-based 3D dice rolling application using Three.js and HTML. The application will feature a realistic 3D die model, physics-based animation for the roll, and a clean, responsive user interface for interaction.

stages.name: Stage 1: Build Core
stages.mission: Initialize the Three.js scene, create the 3D geometry for a standard six-sided die, and set up the basic render loop to display the object on the screen.

stories.title: Setup HTML and CDN Dependencies
stories.description: Create the HTML structure and import Three.js from a CDN (e.g., unpkg or cdnjs). Ensure the canvas container is ready for rendering.

stories.title: Initialize Three.js Scene
stories.description: Create the Scene, Camera, and Renderer. Add basic lighting (Ambient and Directional) to the scene.

stories.title: Create 3D Die Geometry
stories.description: Generate a BoxGeometry for the die. Apply a standard material (MeshStandardMaterial) with a distinct color (e.g., white or ivory).

stories.title: Implement Render Loop
stories.description: Set up the animation loop using requestAnimationFrame to render the scene continuously.

stages.name: Stage 2: Add Physics & Animation
stages.mission: Implement the logic to animate the die's rotation and position to simulate a physical roll, ensuring it lands on a random face.

stories.title: Implement Physics Simulation Logic
stories.description: Create a function to calculate a random rotation vector (x, y, z) and a random velocity vector. This will drive the animation.

stories.title: Add Animation Loop for Rotation
stories.description: Update the die's rotation in the render loop based on the calculated velocity. Add friction to slow the rotation down over time.

stories.title: Implement Landing Detection
stories.description: Detect when the rotation speed drops to near zero. Snap the die to the nearest 90-degree angle to ensure the face is clearly visible.

stages.name: Stage 3: Polish & Interaction
stages.mission: Add user controls, visual feedback, and finalize the UI to make the tool intuitive and visually appealing.

stories.title: Add User Interaction (Button)
stories.description: Create a 'Roll' button in the HTML. When clicked, trigger the physics animation logic defined in Stage 2.

stories.title: Display Result
stories.description: Calculate which face is currently visible (based on rotation) and display the result number on the UI.

stories.title: Refine Visuals
stories.description: Add shadows, improve lighting, and ensure the camera angle provides a good perspective of the die.
